name: Verify that the Client drop down allows the user to multi select clients
justification: Covers a critical business process (client selection), involves data manipulation (multi-selection), and tests a core functionality.

name: Verify that ‘Click on more than one group to multi-select’ message is displayed above Select job type group dropdown
justification: Validates a critical business process (instructional message), but does not cover complex functionality or security aspects.

name: Verify that the Select Job type Group allows the user to multi select
justification: Covers core functionality (multi-select in dropdown), involves data manipulation, and different integrated components.

name: Verify that Select document dropdown documents in the default list show regardless of any clients selected
justification: Tests core functionality, but lacks complexity and does not involve multiple integrated components.

name: Verify that the select document drop down will be filtered based on the clicent/clients, job type group/groups selected
justification: Involves data manipulation based on user inputs (critical business process), covers integration points, and could be prone to errors.

name: Verify that each combination is unique and will only appear once on the drop down list
justification: Ensures data integrity, involves complexity in validation, and covers core functionality.

name: Verify that there is a date picker for document types where expiry applicable has been ticked in the document maintenance page
justification: Tests a critical functionality (expiry date for documents), involves date calculations which can be prone to errors.

name: Verify that the user cannot save documents without selecting an expiry date
justification: High priority due to critical business process (document saving), involves data validation (expiry date), and covers user role permissions (restriction).

name: Verify that the user cannot choose a date in the past
justification: Involves date calculations (past date check), and can prevent critical process failures.

name: Verify that the allowed formats and size of documents are displayed
justification: Tests core functionality (document upload format), but lacks complexity and does not cover multi-component integrations.

name: Verify that drag and drop and click through to choose documents to upload works successfully
justification: Tests core functionality (drag and drop upload), involves complex UI interactions, and has integration points with the file system.

name: Verify that once upload is clicked, the document is uploaded successfully
justification: High business impact, involves integration with backend services, and covers critical file upload functionality.

name: Verify that if upload is clicked without an expiry date selected, the error message is displayed
justification: Critical validation step (expiry date), prevents possible process failures, and involves user permissions (error handling).

name: Verify that if document type is not selected, error message displayed
justification: Validates input fields, prevents critical process failure (document type selection), and involves error handling.

name: Verify that if the document does not match the specified formats required, error message displayed
justification: Validates input restrictions, covers critical functionality (document upload), prevents process failures.

name: Verify that if the document exceeds the specified size, error message is displayed
justification: Validates input restrictions (file size), covers core upload functionality, and involves error handling.

name: Verify that if a document is not added to the drop box, an error message is displayed
justification: Error handling for document upload, covers critical functionality, and involves validation checks.

name: Verify that if a document is uploaded that already exists on the table, that the error message is displayed in a pop up box and when Yes clicked the document is replaced
justification: High priority (duplicate upload handling), covers critical functionality, involves integration, and complex error handling.

name: Verify that the Existing employee documents table has a search box, pagnation, page numbers, page size drop down and the appropriate number of rows based on selection
justification: Covers multiple integrated components (search, pagination), involves user interaction, and data manipulation.

name: Verify that a column for File Name is included on the existing employee documents table
justification: Validates UI display (column presence), but lacks complexity and does not cover multiple integrations.

name: Verify that once an agency is selected, the table with worker details is displayed
justification: Tests core functionality (data display for agency selection), covers integration points, and is a critical business process.

name: Verify that a Mandatory Document column is to be added to the worker details page once the + has been selected for a worker
justification: Validates UI change (column addition), but does not involve complex functionality or multiple integrations.

name: Verify that if the document has been selected as mandatory in the Documents Maintenance Page, Yes is to be displayed in this column
justification: Involves validation based on another page's inputs, covers critical functionality (mandatory document display), and is a core feature.

name: Verify that if the document does not have mandatory selected in the Documents Maintenance Page, No is to be displayed in this column
justification: Involves validation based on another page's settings, covers critical functionality, and ensures data consistency.

name: Verify that the Verified column is to be replaced by the Expiry Date Column
justification: Validates UI change (column replacement), and lacks complexity or coverage of multiple integrations.
